Introduction

Jung Dae Hyun is a South Korean singer under M.A Entertainment. He is a member of the boy group B.A.P.

He debuted as a soloist on April 5, 2019, with the mini album, Chapter 2 "27".

Daehyun debuted on January 26, 2012, as a member of B.A.P. On February 17, 2019, TS Entertainment stated that the four remaining members of B.A.P have all elected not to renew their contracts with the agency.

On April 5, 2019, Daehyun released his first solo mini album, Chapter2 "27", and its title track "You're My". The album features Jaehan of SPECTRUM.

On June 17, he signed with STX Lion Heart (now known as Lionheart Entertainment).

On October 27, 2020, a source from Lionheart Entertainment stated that Daehyun would quietly enlist as an active-duty soldier on November 17. On September 23, it was announced that he was cast in the military musical Blue Helmet: A Song of Meissa. He was discharged on May 16, 2022.

On December 29, MA Entertainment announced that Jung Dae Hyun had signed with them to promote in diverse fields actively.
